questions.question: What is the primary function of the incremental encoder in this project?

answers.a: To provide a continuous analog signal.
answers.b: To generate digital pulses for speed measurement.
answers.c: To act as a variable resistor.
answers.d: To provide a static position reading.

questions.question: Why is a hardware interrupt used in this project?

answers.a: To control the brightness of the LCD.
answers.b: To stop the motor when a certain RPM is reached.
answers.c: To accurately count pulses without missing any at high speeds.
answers.d: To provide a constant voltage to the motor.

questions.question: What is the main role of the Op-Amp and NPN transistor in your circuit?

answers.a: To provide power to the Arduino.
answers.c: To condition and amplify the weak encoder signal.
answers.d: To act as a voltage divider.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the number of pulses and the calculated RPM in your code?

answers.b: RPM is the number of pulses multiplied by 3.
answers.c: RPM is the number of pulses divided by 2.

questions.question: Why is the 12V DC motor connected to a separate 12V power supply instead of the Arduino's 5V pin?

answers.a: The motor's voltage and current requirements are higher than what the Arduino can provide.
answers.b: The motor will run faster on a separate power supply.
answers.c: The separate power supply is used for safety purposes.
answers.d: The motor will damage the Arduino if connected to its 5V pin.
